interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Spa Grade Jade Roller for Face with Gua Sha | Jade Face Roller Massager | Jade Facial Roller | Face Roller Massager | Jade Rollers | Wrinkle Roller Review Date: 2019/01/07 Store: Jane Cosmetics Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.1 x 3.4 x 1.2 inches; 4.8 Ounces', 'UPC': '814689026516', 'Manufacturer': 'Jane & Co.'} Review Text: Before receiving Jane & Co.'s Roller and Gua Sha, I had never really used anything like it on my skin before. For me, it was simply wash, dry, moisturize and occasionally use makeup.

The roller and Gua Sha that I received is supposedly made of Jade. To me, it looked more like New Zealand Nephrite or even Aventurine. The packaging and product are nicely done, complete with a handwritten note from the proprietress of Jane & Co.

There is a small pamphlet with a set of instructions that includes a contact number where you can send a text to receive a complete guide on how to use both the roller and the Gua Sha. Instantly, you are given a URl to download the free eBook to go with the product.

To use either the roller or Gua Sha you simply chill the implements in the refrigerator or freezer. This extra coolness helps to shrink the pores and ease any puffiness that might be present.

Wash your face as normal to avoid pushing any dirt or impurities in your skin with the roller. Dry your face and apply a moisturizing oil such as coconut oil, jojoba, or argan oil which are particularly nourishing to the skin.

Take your now-cool roller and roll over your face, from the center outward. The included instructions suggest to pay particular attention to the area around the nose and under the eyes to aid in the draining and circulation of the lymph glands in those areas.

To use the Gua Sha, again, cleanse the face, and moisturize with an oil that is beneficial for the skin. Never, Never NEVER use mineral oil on the face (or anywhere else on the body for that matter).

Using moderate yet firm pressure in a gentle scraping motion to ease out tension from the face. I confess I haven't quite gotten the hang of the Gua Sha yet, but I am still working on it. The coolness of these facial tools feels excellent on my skin and it definitely is a relaxing practice to get into regularly. Review Title: Give your face a beauty massage! Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Skincare Enthusiast**: Demonstrates a keen interest in skincare practices, particularly using facial tools for wellness and beauty.
- **Preference for Natural Materials**: Values products made from natural materials, such as jade, indicating a preference for holistic and traditional beauty methods.
- **Instruction-Oriented**: Appreciates clear guides and instructions for using skincare tools, suggesting a methodical approach to new beauty routines.
- **Focus on Hydration**: Emphasizes the importance of moisturizing oils, indicating a preference for nourishing and hydrating skin treatments.
- **Relaxation and Self-Care**: Enjoys the relaxation aspect of skincare rituals, highlighting a trend towards self-care and stress relief through beauty practices.
- **Seeking Improvement**: Open to learning and improving techniques (e.g., Gua Sha), showing a commitment to mastering new skills and enhancing her skincare routine.
- **Product Experience and Feedback**: Engages with brands that offer thoughtful packaging and customer interaction, indicating a preference for brands that prioritize customer experience.

Overall, the user values effective, natural skincare tools and practices that emphasize both beauty and wellness, coupled with a community-oriented brand experience.
